items.name: Advanced Gunnery Control
items.summary: Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0
items.description:
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0
Download: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/releases

This mod gives you more control over the way weapon groups behave when on autofire. For each weapon group, you can select one or more tags, such as e.g. holding fire when flux > X% or avoiding shields, to customise how that group should behave. Also features basic ship modes (e.g. LowerShields when Flux > 50%) and two ~~badly~~  expertly done GUIs.
Can be added/removed/updated to/from an ongoing campaign.

1.6.0 fixes some minor issues, adds two new tags (Range<N% and ShipTarget) and makes the combat GUI lib usable for mod authors (cf. https://github.com/DesperatePeter/test-combat-gui-lib)

Note for faction/content extension mod authors: Instead of suggested modes/suffixes, you can now list suggested tags for your weapons in modSettings.json. If you had already added weapon modes/suffxies, feel free to leave them in for compatibility  with older versions.  (refer to https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/blob/master/data/config/modSettings.json#L16 for an example). 
For details on how to add tags to enemy ships: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control#assigning-tags-to-enemy-ship-weapons

Please let me know if you encounter any issues or have some feedback!

Thanks in advance and happy gaming/modding!

items.summary: The tournament grinds on, and as punishment for my sins several nerfs have been delivered. Inshallah I will be permitted to buff a few things after it is over.
items.description:
The tournament grinds on, and as punishment for my sins several nerfs have been delivered. Inshallah I will be permitted to buff a few things after it is over.

```- Thunderstorm SLRM: Removed hard flux on shield hit from frag mines. Reduced mine attraction speed (60 -> 30), frag mine armor strip (50 -> 25), frag mine damage (600 -> 500), and missile HP (450 -> 400).
- Arcspikes/Arcstorm: reduced damage (125 -> 110), EMP (200 -> 175) and top speed (700 -> 550). Reduced Canister Pod range (1500 -> 1200).
- Arcmine Dispenser: Reduced mine arc radius (400 -> 300). Reduced charge regen (10s -> 12s). AI is now slightly more hesitant to spend all its charges at once.
- Toroid Mortar: Fixed a minor graphical bug (this is a buff).```

items.name: Arkships
items.summary:
This mod adds "Arkships" in to the Sector. Arkships are custom Stations that by using an Ability can be moved to any Starsystem.
They do not participate in the economy and you can’t build Industries on them, but you can activate and deactivate Compartments which enable Features as you do so.
items.description:
This mod adds "Arkships" in to the Sector. Arkships are custom Stations that by using an Ability can be moved to any Starsystem.
They do not participate in the economy and you can’t build Industries on them, but you can activate and deactivate Compartments which enable Features as you do so.
The Core Component is the Arkship-Storage, allowing you to move an entire Stations Inventory through the sector.
More details can be found on the Forum post.

**Changelog** :

-> Fixed a bug that due to an oversight wiped the arkships inventory when the player hovered over the storage industries icon in the colony tab
--> The update also removes the compartments industries, the compartments are now added without them, updating the mod should automaticly remove them.

(Oh my god tracking this down was annoying)

**Forum Post**: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25091.0>

Features 5 "Modules" which should be used separately and will mess faction balance in various ways:

**Pirates but Epic:** gives pirates access to all visible-on-intel-screen faction ships, hullmods, weapons and wings.
**Pirates but Epic-er:** gives pirates  access to all hull/weapon/wing/hullmod specs (unique bosses and etc. included).

**Faction Blender:** gives visible-on-intel-screen factions access to all visible-on-intel-screen faction ships, hullmods, weapons and wings.
**Faction Blender REVENGANCE:** gives all factions access to all faction ships, hullmods, weapons and wings.
**Faction Blender SUPREME:** gives all factions access to all hull/weapon/wing/hullmod specs (unique bosses and etc. included).

items.summary:
*Adds hullmods that automatically trigger various orders when certain conditions are achieved*
```
items.description:
*Adds hullmods that automatically trigger various orders when certain conditions are achieved*
```
 * Retreat when the ship is below a certain hull integrity level. (90% or 60% or 30%)
 * Retreat when the ship has exceeded its peak performance time.
 * Retreat when the ship is below a certain CR level. (60% or 40% or 0%)
 * Retreat when the ship has no missile left. (the hullmod can only be added to ships with least one missile weapon equipped)

 * Override the personality for non-officered ships (should work for flagship on auto)
 * Vent when flux above 80%. This does not activate while the ship is manually being piloted by the player
```

items.name: BlockTags
items.summary: *Currently incompatible with BDSM, because their scripts are uncompiled (but otherwise fully compatible).*
items.description:
*Currently incompatible with BDSM, because their scripts are uncompiled (but otherwise fully compatible).*

With BlockTags, all you need to make a vanilla hullmod incompatible with one of your own is a tag with the vanilla hullmod's id, and "_block" at the end of it.

Two mods because vanilla's loose script hullmods need to be compiled, but also need to be loaded *first* so mods like BDSM can overwrite them.

(Please tell me if I missed any vanilla incompatibilities, I had a headache by the end of this so my concetration wasn't the greatest.)

items.name: Crew Replacer
items.summary:
an modders utility library thing.
Forum:
items.description:
an modders utility library thing.
Forum:
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=24249.msg360489#msg360489
what is Crew Replacer?
Crew Replacer is a mod library built with one goal in mind: to make it easy and quick to mod in new items to be used in jobs. crew replacer lets multiple modders modify the same tasks, by adding a system that lets a modder add an 'crew'(really any type of commodity) to an 'job'. were said 'job's replace all the instances of crew I could find in code.

but what dose that mean? it means that modders now have a system to to change what is used/required when the one tries to 'salvage' or 'survey' or 'raid'. it also means that modders have a system to add new jobs into the game, then let other modders change what is used/required in said task.
updated to version 0.3.4
```
V0.3.4
    -fixes:
        fixed supplyDemandChange crashing the 
game because of bad code when supply change was ran.
    please dont get used supplyDemandClass being in 
crewReplacer. its going to be moved into its own project in an month or 3. so if you do need it for something it might be better to wait for that
```

```Fast, Safe, Functional aka FSF Corporation is a military corporation founded after the Collapse to sell arms and OEM ships. Its founding dates back to a pre-Collapse powerful smuggling ring, with ties to many of the equipment testing units of the Domain of Man, selling prototypes to various corporations at high prices. With the failure of the Gates, the upper echelons of the syndicate were trapped in a secret warehouse in Perseus. Knowing that the power at their disposal was far from sufficient to protect the precious cargo in the warehouse, they relied on the mountains of supplies within to completely disappear from the incoming disputes and set up the FSF predecessor as an underground organization.

In the golden age after the First AI War, the sporadic appearance of foreign trade warships that people had never seen before in the defense of the Edge World colonies symbolized the FSF's emergence on the Perseus scene as the giant corporation known today for providing, among other things, shipbuilding, military instruction, and weapons trade. Although they have always been a mega-corporation following the laws of the Hegemony throughout the Sector, in recent years their fleet numbers have risen steeply to show their ambition.```
Adds the eponymous faction, a few new mechanics, a quest alongside a plethora or ships and weapons.

Note that release may have some translation errors or idiosyncrasies. Please contact me if you find any.

items.name: Fast Engine Rendering
items.summary: Uses modern OpenGL rendering techniques to efficiently render custom engine plumes. The main purpose of this mod is a performance boost, taking advantage of modern GPU horsepower. The increase is found through removing CPU load and transferring it to the GPU, which vanilla starsector does not take advantage tremendously.
items.description:
Uses modern OpenGL rendering techniques to efficiently render custom engine plumes. The main purpose of this mod is a performance boost, taking advantage of modern GPU horsepower. The increase is found through removing CPU load and transferring it to the GPU, which vanilla starsector does not take advantage tremendously.

Requires a GPU that supports OpenGL 3.3

```
v1.1.0
-updated shader code to optimised versions from Jon Micheelsen
-tweaked glow visuals
-fixed bugs with system activated engines for good hopefully
-reload engine data with F8
-fixed bug with force override setting```

Features:
> Replace SHIP (and fighter) engine plumes and glows with a fast instanced renderer. Moderate testing suggests a ~25% increase in performance in large battles with many fighter/ships, your mileage may vary.
> Crisp 😩 👌 and smooth engine visual

Caveats:
> Does not affect missile engines, they will still use vanilla behaviour. Engine colour changing has been implemented for Safety Overrides, Plasma Jets and Plasma Burn, however any other modded effects will not take effect because it is hardcoded, this is not fixable unfortunately.

items.summary: The First Persean Empire (FPE) is a tinpot totalitarian dictatorship in the Danube system. Having conquered its system through force, the Empire now puts up a strong image of strength. However, the reality is very different, with most of the Empire's resources being used to put down dissent and rebellion. Widely despised by the Sector at large, the only reason it persists is due to a complicated political situation - a situation which may change shortly in the future.

Note: the only compatible Java 8 are version 271, please check pinned post in <#512356777451323393>

Download
Windows:

Linux Distro:
https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1GmvL4H43r6PmvZbzKqzHNC7tHM7U0fZm&export=download
MacOS:
https://drive.google.com/uc?id=124yMChlacYYdosEngoDhQtOl7Kk1PCUb&export=download

Changelogs :
```
-Disable SystemGC, its unnecessary (JRE7/JRE8)
-Show Error Dialog instead of failing to launch silently (JRE8)
-Now come in three different flavor for Windows, Linux-based Distro, MacOS
```

Ever frustrated why your startup loading times is so awful?, got a high-end PC and want to use more of its memory size and speed?, or optimize your potato laptop to play this game?.. we got you covered with 1/2/3/4/6/8GB VMParam. Brought to you lovingly after a week of testing.

```
Packs Included:
- JRE7 Safe Pack
- JRE8 Safe/Aggresive/Dangerous Pack
- For 1/2/3/4/6/8GB
- G1GC Hide Leak Messages mods
```

Key differences between packs
All share the same trait of having a low latency multi-threaded GC (the janitor you may call it) to reclaim unused memory and make the game smooth. For starter I recommending the Safe pack but if you trust your high end PC to pack a punch do give Dangerous pack a go. As for people who're curious about what this do read the Documentation.txt included on each pack.

Known issues
```
- Due to how the mod works, the game may show "Memory Leak! Campaign Duplicates" over time. This is okay!

- However if one of your mod list does have a memory leak.. this mod may fail to clean extra copies.
```

Fully save compatible! If the game doesn't launch after you replace the `vmparam` and you're using JRE8 pack, make sure the `jre` folder is already swapped with JRE8!

items.name: Guts' Sword from Berserk got thrown into Starsector by the Godhand
HMI Supervillains 0.0.4: Mini-Beta-Campaign-Layer-Update
items.summary: The Draco Group and the Fang Society are two truly deranged factions that inhabit the south-western part of the sector. Both organisations suffer from an obsession with gene-modding to go above conventional humanity in strength, speed, intelligence - and cruelty.
items.description:
The Draco Group and the Fang Society are two truly deranged factions that inhabit the south-western part of the sector. Both organisations suffer from an obsession with gene-modding to go above conventional humanity in strength, speed, intelligence - and cruelty.

The Draco Group, aristocratic and cold, harvest populations to imbibe their blood in their hedonistic rituals, reaving on high-speed high-tech ships from the system of Prester John. The Fang Society, animalistic and vicious, prey on defenseless peoples to consume, eat and torture, roaming the sector from heavily armoured ships.

While their hatred for the Sector is well know, their loathing for each other is even greater. It is for this reason that their impact on the Sector at large is relatively minor, as they are more content to butcher each other.

*0.0.4 Changes*

-Both Fang and Draco have had their markets beefed up, and their faction stats overhauled.
-Added spicy boss-ish fleets to Phylum and Prestor John systems.
-Added Two MagicBounties, giving you a chance to find and use some truly despicable boats.
-Fiddled with a lot of the stats.
-Lots of tiny little fixes.

*Savegame Compatible, but beyond the MagicBounties you won't see new stuff without a new game*

**ALPHA 0.3.5**

-Added a *lot* more weapons to fill some niches.
-Added two new techmined fighters; a heavy, powerful fighter and a high-tech antimatter bomber.

-Removed Decimator; this ship has been replaced with the Vanguard / Brawler.
-Removed the Finch (No one remembers this).
-Removed the Drone Firing system from the Whiskey Priest and Donkey due to rare CTD crash, instead they have dedicated suicide drone wings.
-Bombardment Pod no longer fires Annhiliators. Instead, it fires *itself*.

-Rejigged how HMI ships and weapons show up; they should be less common in Scavenger, Independent and Pirate fleets.
-Reworked HMI variants.
-Fixed a lot of other minor problems + mis-spellings

-Added 3 new weapons (Chances some of these will be cut from next version)

-Made the Mess Scarier

**Update 0.3.5d**
-Fixed a code of Mysterious Origin; Secret Bosses will now properly drop blueprints.

items.summary: Today marks one year since I released my first mod JYD. I have looked back at the changelog entries and am so thankful for the dozens of players who have added to and tweaked the mod since release. The patch includes some fixes, a new hull mod, a new wing and a new Destroyer. As part of the update I also replaced the image for the bounty ship, Eaglefang. Darkwarrior1000 pointed out to me that Dark Revenant uses the same Spiral Arms image in SWP and they added it a couple weeks before I did so I thought it was the right thing to do. I am pretty happy with the kitbash (image below is the old on left and new on right) and I hope you enjoy it as well.
items.description:
Today marks one year since I released my first mod JYD. I have looked back at the changelog entries and am so thankful for the dozens of players who have added to and tweaked the mod since release. The patch includes some fixes, a new hull mod, a new wing and a new Destroyer. As part of the update I also replaced the image for the bounty ship, Eaglefang. v0.13 release notes
- Neoterra changes:
 -- Farming replaced with Hunting & Gathering industry, supplying food and exotic beasts
 -- New commodity, exotic beasts, found exclusively on Neoterra
 -- Subterranean Foundries increases planet's fleet size by 1.5x
 -- Anomalous Interior adds large bonus to ground defense; partially offset by downgrade of Heavy Batteries to Heavy Boulders (total change x3 -> x5)
- Caveman mass-immigration. Planets captured or colonized by KoT will gain Decivilized Subpopulation after (10 * planet size) days. This can be reversed if another faction recaptures the planet before this time. (Planet capture/transfer requires Nexerelin or similar.)
- New dockside bar art & description for KoT planets. Meet contacts in style
- Mammoth: Wool patches have been tweaked graphically to clash less with damage and engine flames

items.name: LOSS v1.1
items.summary: *AKA: Why is there a v1.1?*
items.description:
*AKA: Why is there a v1.1?*

After totally polling the community and receiceing *0* responses, v1.1 is finally here! What is v1.1? Why don't you ask why is v1.1!

This update(?) includes:
- Faction flags now have decided to get in on the action and now are proudly wearing their lovely overpriced Sindrian Sunglasses. Why.
- Thanks to changes in cultural trends, everyone now wants sunglasses and they want it now! Who cares about regular domestic and luxury goods? Sunglasses is where it's at!
- The Church of Galatic Redemption has officially banned sunglasses.
- Why yes, Marines are in fact wearing two sunglasses at once.

Enjoy LOSS today!*

*Why oh why is there a v1.1? This thing shouldn't even have had a v1.0.

The more-complete Changelog will be posted soon.

However:

(RECENT)

The Hammerhead (TB), E-XXXII 'Havoc', E-XXXII 'Havoc' (TB) and Brawler (TB) should all now properly spawn in pirate fleets.

Some minor writeup and hotfixing for weapon arcs.

The E-XXI 'Jerrycan' now has a (TB) cruiser version that can sometimes rarely replace Ventures in pirate fleets.

(      )

A lot of balance changes have occurred since 0.9.1 Starsector, mainly to Pirate vessels.

There's a fair number of new ships, fighters and weapons since the last major patch (0.5.5).

The Hegemony and Independents will now make use of a new manufacturing line of ships alongside their usual retinue.

The Duinn Thunderbirds (TB) now spawn as rare pirate vessels in fleets (simmilar to how you encounter (XIV) variants for Hegemony ships).

Expect to see new Derelict vessels when exploring.

items.name: MagicLib
items.summary: This is a small maintenance update, with a few requested addition from other modders. This is a short "pre-release" to make sure everything new works and I did not break anything else.
items.description:
This is a small maintenance update, with a few requested addition from other modders. This is a short "pre-release" to make sure everything new works and I did not break anything else.

```
 - Added MagicAsteroid plugins to restore functionalities related to asteroids that have been removed in the vanilla game (by SafaryJohn)
     
 - MagicIncompatibleHullmod: now handles hullmods with scripted incompatibilities that have been S-modded by removing the incompatible hullmod added instead of itself. (Thanks to Timid)
     
 - MagicCampaign: CreateFleet now handles fleets that have a spawn location but no assignment target.
     
 - MagicBounty: Hopefuly fixed the log spam after a bounty expired.
```
The goal of MagicLib is to create an Open Source, community driven "library" of useful (and well documented) scripts and plugins that can be leveraged and contributed to by every modder.

Check the Wiki for all the details: <https://starsector.fandom.com/wiki/MagicLib>

**Download:** <https://www.patreon.com/posts/66188070>

items.name: More combat terrain effects 0.3.3 InDev
items.summary: Adds custom combat effects to all terrain that did not have an effect previously.
items.description:
Adds custom combat effects to all terrain that did not have an effect previously.
Currently implemented: Magnetic field - Reduces weapon range, fighter range, missile maneuverability/guidance, vision range, and adds a small chance for missiles to have guidance scrambled.
Slipstream - Force SO on all ships, fighters, and MISSILES, (venting allowed but with reduced effectiveness, for things like excelsior), slowly passively generate hardflux.
Nebula: Nebula clouds reduce weapon range, vision, speed, and disable zero-flux boost while inside of them.
Deep hyperspace (Beta): Spawn nebula clouds. Hyperstorms will cause these clouds to zap anyone who enters them, periodically, with a very powerful EMP bolt.

Safe to add and remove from saves. Probably.

https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25567

items.name: Quality Captains
items.summary:
A gameplay-first, balance friendly, fully configurable skill overhaul. ~~Now with more cursed easter eggs.~~
Compared to vanilla, skills have more even value, stronger roles, and more flexibility. Fleet point effects have been removed, new (and old) effects have been added, and several skills have received all-new dynamic constraints.
items.description:
A gameplay-first, balance friendly, fully configurable skill overhaul. ~~Now with more cursed easter eggs.~~
Compared to vanilla, skills have more even value, stronger roles, and more flexibility. Fleet point effects have been removed, new (and old) effects have been added, and several skills have received all-new dynamic constraints. 
Also includes a thorough and fully customizable ECM and Navigation overhaul.
Save friendly, can be added and removed in ongoing games. 
```1.1.0 - Full 0.95.1a release. 
- Users from the release candidates will want to update for tweaks, polish, and a full review of default armor bonuses.
1.1.1
- Changed the behavior of the ECM skill to count each electronic warfare skill toward ECM score rather than just checking that you have at least 1. 
- Corrected an error in the description of Point Defense that was displaying half the configured value for anti-fighter damage.
- Various fixes to the Automated Ships skill. It should now display and act exactly as configured.
- Restored Bulk Transport's civilian ship burn bonus and added the corresponding config. 
111h
- Removed a duplicate Hypercognition skill. Will probably require no AI Governors or a new game. No urgent changes.
```
Forum thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21038

items.name: Rebalanced Doom
items.summary: A minimod that changes the Doom to be less oppressive while maintaining its identity.
items.description:
A minimod that changes the Doom to be less oppressive while maintaining its identity.

Active changes:
- Removes the ability to deploy mines while phasing.
- Reduces the range of the mine strike system from 1500 to 800.

Goal of the mod:
- Make the Doom less annoying to play against and less overpowered to play as.
- Make it harder and riskier to use well.
- Keep its core identity as a backstabbing ship intact.
- Make sure that the AI is able to use the changed ship well.
- Do it with as few changes as possible.

Forum thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21607.0
Download link: https://github.com/Zymoz/Rebalanced-Doom/releases/download/1.0/Rebalanced.Doom.zip

items.name: Red Hyperspace - "How did I forget about slipstreams" Update
items.summary: -Thank you Citizen Joe, for reminding me that slipstreams exist.
items.description:
-Thank you Citizen Joe, for reminding me that slipstreams exist.

*Hyperspace is a vital tool to us, a means of communication and transport. Without it, there would be no Domain of Man, for there would be no quick bridges between the stars. We use it, and we harness it, but we have no absolute control over it. It is a wild thing that tolerates our presence, but brooks no mastery. There is power in hyperspace, fundamental power, not good, nor evil, but elemental and anathema to us. It is a tool we use at our own risk.*

items.name: Remnant Command Transfer
items.summary: Does exactly what it says on the tin. This lets you transfer command to your remnant ships in combat. It doesn't remove the requirement for AI core officers, or allow you to set automated ships as flagship, since they require the AI officer.
items.description:
Does exactly what it says on the tin. This lets you transfer command to your remnant ships in combat. It doesn't remove the requirement for AI core officers, or allow you to set automated ships as flagship, since they require the AI officer.

Please note that integrating an AI core will still block command transfer. That's handled by (non-moddable) core code.

Save compatible- can be added or removed mid-save with no issues.

```- Fixed the version file saying it was for HTE. Whoops.```

items.name: Ship Catalogue/Variant Editor
items.summary: *No more relying on modders creating a showcase mission for you!*
items.description:
*No more relying on modders creating a showcase mission for you!*

Provides four main menu missions:
-one for all the ships in vanilla
-one for all the ships added by mods filtered on a per-mod basis
-one that allows custom searches through editing a CSV file
-one for mod makers that lists variants with some common issues

Other Features:
- Ship filters to avoid spoilers
- Weapon/wing filters so you can also look at only the relevant mod gear (or mod gear + vanilla (or [REDACTED]^2 weapons))
- Perma-modding s/d-mods in case you want to try out some builds without loading the campaign and doing a bunch of console commands
- Testing officer abilities in sim

```
v1.7.0
-added ability to add officers for sim testing
-ship names now use the hull id (someone will find that useful maybe)
-sweep sweep
```

items.name: Shush, Be Quiet - a logger suppression mod
items.summary: This mod changes the way Starsector logger works. Once the game fully initialises (you arrive at the main menu), only warnings, errors, critical messages, and crashes from vanilla game will be logged. Mods will still log information and above.
items.description:
This mod changes the way Starsector logger works. Once the game fully initialises (you arrive at the main menu), only warnings, errors, critical messages, and crashes from vanilla game will be logged. Mods will still log information and above.

Both are configurable via `data/config/settings.json`. Enjoy quiet days.

Download: https://github.com/jaghaimo/shush/releases/download/1.0.0/shush-1.0.0.zip

items.name: Simple Skill Tweaks 1.0
items.summary: Makes very simple tweaks to some skills that my addled brain came up with. Part QoL, part 'immersion', part nerf. Any undesired changes to a skill can be reverted at any time by deleting the relevant .skill file in Simple Skill Tweaks>data>characters>skills. **Please see the readme.txt inside for the exact changes** and inane reasoning.
items.description:
Makes very simple tweaks to some skills that my addled brain came up with. Part QoL, part 'immersion', part nerf. Any undesired changes to a skill can be reverted at any time by deleting the relevant .skill file in Simple Skill Tweaks>data>characters>skills. **Please see the readme.txt inside for the exact changes** and inane reasoning.

Hope you get some use out of this, and feel free to @ me if you have any ideas or suggestions. Just be aware I’m probably far too green to be able to implement good ones in any reasonable timeframe.

Thanks to everyone on the discord for knowing things, thanks to <#824910699415207937> for being so generally helpful, and thanks to Histidine for indirectly putting me on to just how easy it is to fiddle with .skill files.

```1.0 : Initial release
- Target Analysis, Field Modulation, Bulk Transport, Navigation, Sensors, Hull Restoration changes```
**NOT compatible with any mod that alters the same skills**

items.name: Star Federation 0.98-RC6 - Beems and Bugfixes
items.summary:
An FTL-Inspired mod by Sleepyfish (& friends) which adds a diverse midline-esque faction, multiple rare ships, and a station!
```
items.description:
An FTL-Inspired mod by Sleepyfish (& friends) which adds a diverse midline-esque faction, multiple rare ships, and a station!
```
       -Added Hull Beam, Hull Beam II
        -Weakish HE beam with shield pierce, but piercing reduces damage based on target free flux.
        -Creates heavy frag damage arcs, arcs scaling with enemy hull size.
    -Added Pike Beam
        -Longboi beam designed to suppress from a distance. No shield pen.
        -Creates low damage frag arcs when impacting hull, scaling with enemy hull size.
    -Added Microbeam
        -Good damage for a small beam weapon. No shield pen.
        -Same arc effects as the Pikebeam.
    -Glaive, Halberd beams
        -Increased damage numbers slightly. Could be scary. 
        -New sounds, old sounds given to Hull beams.
    -Artillery Beam
        -Increased power of beam arcs on shield/hull, including EMP.
        -Always penetrates shields, but will only arc at half the rate.

    -Accordant-class Battlecruiser
        -Flux buffs to better express its energy heavy design.
    -Union-class Battlecarrier
        -Flux nerfs to limit the effectiveness of its hybrid mounts.
    -Kestrel-class Cruiser
        -Prow Armor Module hull increased from 4000 -> 5000.
        -Added Cruise Engines hullmod.
    
    -Reduced OP Cost of Heavy Burst Capacitors to 3/5/9/15
    
    -Star Federation derelicts wont respawn every save load in Random Sector.
    -Star Federation stations are now compatible with the Ind.Evo artillery station!
    -Star Federation Star Fortress has distinct armor modules in campaign/sprite/previews.
    -Probably some other things.
   
See the github link for a more comprehensive changelog!```
**Only save compatible with 0.98 versions.**

items.description:
A content mod that specializes in adding new Hullmods to the game.
Those hullmods change the way you use your ships and give them unique abilities
More information on added content can be found on the Forum Thread. 

__Changes & Additions__
-Vampirisms Visual effects have been slightly improved
-Several changes to the secret system (changed primary star, market doesnt require an active transponder anymore, changed descriptions)

__Balance__
-Vampirism now applies its health over time, instead of instantly. Unused Health (i.e if the ship gets to max health) now gets stored and will heal the ship when it suffers future damage
->This should make the ability decent now, instead of highly situational as it was before.

__Fixes__
-Fixed AI spamming ability activation sounds.

items.name: Truly Automated Ships v1.2.2
items.summary: This mod intends to change the way AI officers assigned to automated ships affect the rest of your fleet.
items.description:
This mod intends to change the way AI officers assigned to automated ships affect the rest of your fleet.

This mod makes it more viable to have powerful automated fleets. It's possible, for example, to have up to three Radiants in your fleet without suffering any CR maluses. The drawback is an increase in the amount monthly supplies required to keep your ships operational. You'll really have to think about how much increasing the power of a given ship is worth to you.

This mod applies a reduction to the "automated ship points" of any ship outfitted with an AI officer, depenging on the type of core.
Having an AI core as an officer also causes a hefty increase to its monthly supply cost, reflecting the huge amount of resources required to run an AI core in the first place.

Please let me know what you think of the numbers. I'm open to tinkering with them to find out which values feel the best to play with.

v1.2.2 changelog
```
- Fixed NullPointer error when loading the game
- (Hopefully) fixed negative ship weight bug
```

items.description:
To be brief, this is a library provides a file format that allows the make up of fleets to be specified in detail. These fleets can then be configured to spawn in the game in place of regular fleets, with no code required. See this mod's forum post for a comprehensive list and explanation of details.

This mod is intended to provide a no scripting required way of implementing themed fleets that occur naturally during gameplay. For example, one could make nexerlin revenge fleets spawn with special ship variants fitting for a boss fleet.

Safe to add and remove

A forgotten weapons of the sector mod, comprised of low key weapons that intend to extend the tactical flexibility of the base weapon slots without overpowering a thing. 

Features four weapons, and two strike craft that make solid use of them. Enjoy ballistic gryojet artillery, a pulsed anti-frigate lance, and a flak torpedo that is quite capable at disabling packs of fighters.

Comes with an optional (early testing) submod that features some experimental hullmods.

*Update 0.2f:* Fixed an issue where graphics lib would despawn many of the mods projectiles.

items.name: What does this mod do?
items.summary:
It allows you, the player, to have 1 portrait that you and only you can choose. The player faction can't pick it, the NPCs cannot as well. You can replace the portrait with anything else to override it. Keep the name, resolution, and format the same. Meant to be prescribed to players who just want a unique player portrait to themselves. If you want to change the gender look inside the player.faction file. Right now it is defaulted to a male gender. There are instructions on wanting a unique female player portrait within the player.faction file. Burn bright, starfarer!
*Can I add more?*

items.name: [0.95.1a] Starfighter Intrastellar Modification Program (SIMP) - 0.99F
items.summary: Nobody saw that.
items.description:
Nobody saw that.

Not save compatible with ***any*** previous versions of the mod.

Foreword:
So as far as I'm concerned, this mod is now finished. I needed to remove the mod's modularity because hidden modular hardpoints kept breaking other people's mods. As a result, removing the loadout flexibility was a necessary step, as the weapon sprites covered all of the actual ship. It was a necessary step for functionality, but with my own level of skill, I wouldn't be able to preserve my original vision for the mod by doing any decoration weapon wizardry.

So it was a lot of fun, and I don't regret my time spent on this little endeavour, but this is the final update for SIMP, barring any catastrophic issues that need immediate resolution.

The tl;dr:
-Requires Arma Armatura and its dependencies to work.
-Adds six strikecraft and five fighters.
-Safe to add, can't verify whether safe to remove.

Changes this patch:
-All ships have built-in, pre-selected weapon loadouts now.
-All ships now generate no weapon flux.
-Flux values drastically reduced to accommodate for weapons no longer creating flux. Flux values are for shields only, now.

Changes last patch:
-Brought DP costs slightly back up, and increased wing OP costs as well. Even after the rework, they're still way stronger than vanilla fighters, and those values should reflect that. 

Credits/Shoutouts:
-Shoi for designing ARMAA and making this project possible in the first place.
-CenturionChet for inspiring me to go down this rabbithole  by making his own mod first.
-Tibby for thinking my kitbashed sprites are cute.
-Amazigh for advising me about kitbashing's viability when I was initially struggling with spriting.
-Doogydong for advice on balance revolving around the Raphus.
-Lavoroxan for more advice around balancing the mod in general!
-Quartofel for doling out advice as well.
-Anyone else whose usernames I can't recall off the top of my head, who helped me with my many, many questions.
-And the entire community. Thank you.

items.name: [Utility - Not a Mod] SSOS - Starsector Simulation Opponent Stripper v1.1
items.description:
``` v1.1
    - Fixed a crash that would occur if you tried to strip a CSV from a mod that already existed in the backups folder
    - Fixed a crash that would occur if you tried to revert changes after replacing a mod's CSV file in your main directory
    - Fixed an issue with the default exemptions.txt```

Do you like hoarding mods? Do you have so many ships in your game that your Simulation's Deployment screen takes 10 seconds to load and tanks your framerate while open?

You probably answered no to most/all of these questions, but to the few who are still reading, congratulations! I made a tool specifically to address this niche issue. SSOS is an interactive Python script that allows you to instantly strip those pesky sim_opponent.CSVs from all of your mods, leaving you with a smooth and uncluttered Deployment screen. Detailed information is available in the thread below:

https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25595.0

Direct Download (read the thread tho):

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DJQdcnBIXY9i036DagR0cRGWtriPysoS/view?usp=share_link

Ever wanted to mix up the colors of Hyperspace a little bit, and see something new?, you stumbled upon the right place!.

This mod recolors the dark blue Hyperspace background to a more lively and pleasant teal, while jump-points and even the illustrations featuring these points have been changed to reflect the new colors that i gave them!.
▬▬
1.0.2 changes:
-Potentially adjusted the brightness of jump-points a bit?
-Tweaked the color of hyperspace clouds, should be easier to tell storm areas from regular ones.
-Jump-point graphics in the background of combats (courtesy of Secrets of the Frontier) now are recolored to match the recolors provided in this mod.
*(Some bits look funny tho, no idea why)*
-Hyperspace exit illustration re-colored from scratch, looks much better now!.
-This is the second release of this little mod, woohoo!

items.name: 🌸  YunruVerse Core 🌸
items.summary: Consisting of YunruCore and it's immediate dependents, the YunruVerse is a collection of five ship mods, one weapons weapon, and a hullmods mod.
items.description:
Consisting of YunruCore and it's immediate dependents, the YunruVerse is a collection of five ship mods, one weapons weapon, and a hullmods mod.

***Be sure to do a clean install: Delete all previous versions first. (Note: Misc got split into Higher Tech, Old School, and Civ)***

Higher Tech Expansion:
> Escort frigates, frontline shield-tanks, minelayers, and more!

Midline Expansion:
> Dedicated missiles ships, a wider expanse of broadsiders, support frigates, and more!

Old School Expansion:
> Bricky ships, take a beating, keep on... beating.

Pirates and Pathers:
> Pirate ships "designed" by throwing together whatever salvage was at hand, with a bare minimum threshold for being put into active service, as they are want to do.
> Blessed ships anointed to carry out Ludd's will. Inevitable involves explosions.

Civilian Utilities and Navigational Technologies:
> Capital-class personnel carriers, exploration cruisers that can achieve parity with military ships when themselves militarised, etc.

Hullmods:
> More hullmods to further customise and specialise your ships with, scattered across the sector and it's factions.
> "Install" hullmods that permanently modify your ship in various ways.
> AI core integration, unlocking its own set of powerful hullmods to arm your ships with, scaling in power based on the level of core.

Arsenal:
> A collection of weapons that I thought would be interesting. Balance is probably wonky both up and down, as I've yet to establish a testing practice that I find works for me, but should still be fun.

*Available at: https://www.patreon.com/posts/mod-links-60097706*

items.name: 🌸 Yunru Industries 🌸
items.summary: A small collection of Industries/Industry changes to enhance colonies.
items.description:
A small collection of Industries/Industry changes to enhance colonies.
> Tech Mining reworked to remove commodity drops, a depletion tracker added, and Story Point Improvement changed to remove permanent decay.
> The Bazaar functions as a prequel to Commerce, possessing 1/5th the bonuses, but at no stability cost and without requiring an industry slot.
> The Auxiliary Shipbays increases the size of fleets launched from the planet by 25%, while not requiring an industry slot.
> The Secondary Drydocks dedicates yet more space to heavy industry production. When combined with a Heavy Industry or Orbital Works, the output is increased by 50%.
Changes:
> (Hopefully) fixed black markets randomly appearing on player planets.
> Removed military markets from Auxiliary Shipbays.

*Available at: https://www.patreon.com/posts/mod-links-60097706*
